reviews.review_msg: she is really awful professor. It is better she passes some courses to learn how she should treat with student.
This prof should not be teaching period!! I won't be surprised if her teaching score is inflated due to the way the evaluation forms were handled!!
I think the teacher tried to influence the course and lab feedback at the end. I didn't like anything about this course. A lot of people were disgruntled with how things went.

She is a grad student. Unable to communicate the material or does not know it well, so learning suffers. Very incomprehensible with a heavy accent.  I should have taken the STAT equivalent instead or wait for someone else to teach the course. Labs were unclear and too easy. Disappointing teaching and not of a university level.

This is the first time I took a course where the prof is also the TA. This is like conflict of interest. If the prof is useless then you end up being messed up at labs too. That's what happened in this course. Liliana appeared friendly but the materials was too hard for her to teach.

Terrible experience. Her low energy and disinterested teaching style knocked me out a few times. We used two textbooks and two software and learn little quantitative geography itself. Plenty conflicts between what the teacher explains and the textbook. I got a high grade but don't remember a thing from this course.

All I remembered from this course was knee-high black leather riding booths and tight fitting jeans. What was this course about again? I didn't learn much but got a good grade as they were handed out freely!!

The course was disorganized right down to the final exam when the date kept changing. Got the feeling every week that the lectures and labs were cut and paste in a hurry. Totally incompetent... Refund my money as I didn't get what I was promised....
Oh gosh!! Her teaching was atrocious and all over the place. Turned me off completely from stats. What a waste of my time and money.
The best formula to describe my experience is: boring teacher + boring materials + poor language skills + bad notes = horrible course!!

Her teaching sucked big time! I won't take another course with her ever again. The STATS department offer a good alternative course. People!! avoid taking her courses if you are not on her favorites list, your GPA will take a steep nose dive.
This course was like spending one semester in hell. The teacher was horrible at explaining the work. She was unprepared most of the times.

The prof seems clueless about stats and even more clueless how to apply it to geography. Didn't learn much. There were too many textbooks and software to keep track of. Prof seems friendly, but I didn't pay fees to see a smiling face!!
